physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Hypergonadotropic hypogonadism, azoospermia, short stature, premature graying of hair, facial dysmorphism, early cataract in 4 patients, dilated cardiomyopathy in 3, partial growth hormone deficiency in 2.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The clinical manifestations include a progressive condition with varying expression, as patients develop symptoms ranging from neurological deficits to cardiac issues over time.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Cerebral MRI showed right frontal cortical infarct and several bilateral subcortical infarcts in patient III-12. Echocardiography revealed dilated cardiomyopathy with depressed left ventricular fractional shortening.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Patient III-12 exhibited progression of neurological and cardiac symptoms, leading to wheelchair-bound status and eventual death after heart failure.
